rules: Rule1: Provided that the security system is operational, if the smart lighting is connected to the network, then the smart lighting functions.
Rule2: If facial recognition is active, then the security system is operational.
Rule3: Facial recognition is active, or RFID scanners are active.
Rule4: Under the condition that RFID scanners are active, the security system is operational.
Rule5: When meeting room A is scheduled, the work environment is optimal.
Rule6: Either meeting room A is scheduled, or the conference room is booked.
Rule7: Whenever the projector is available, the work environment is optimal.
Rule8: Under the condition that the presentation equipment is reserved, the projector is available.
Rule9: Either the conference booking is cancelled, or if the conference room is booked, then the presentation equipment is reserved.
Rule10: If a standing desk is assigned to employee 1, then the work environment is optimal.
Rule11: A standing desk is assigned to employee 1, or an ergonomic chair is assigned to employee 1.
Rule12: Under the condition that an ergonomic chair is assigned to employee 1, the workstation is configured for employee 1.
Rule13: If the workstation is configured for employee 1, then the keyboard is connected to the workstation.
Rule14: Under the condition that the monitor is connected to the workstation, the work environment is optimal.
Rule15: If the keyboard is connected to the workstation, then the monitor is also connected to the workstation.
Rule16: In the event that the smart thermostat is repaired, it was damaged.
Rule17: Provided that the smart lighting is calibrated, it is functioning.
Rule18: If the smart lighting's firmware is updated, then the smart lighting is calibrated.
Rule19: When access permissions are conflicting, the access level is authorized.
Rule20: Under the condition that a security breach is detected, if access permissions are conflicting, then the access level is not authorized.
Rule21: Either a security breach is detected, or unauthorized access is suspected.
Rule22: Provided that management has approved the IoT upgrade, the IoT upgrade is implemented.
Rule23: Either management has approved the IoT upgrade, or management has rejected the IoT upgrade.
Rule24: Either the permission conflict is resolved, or if unauthorized access is suspected, then when access permissions are conflicting, the access level is not authorized.
Rule25: Whenever the cooling system is triggered, it has failed.
Rule26: A temperature spike is detected, or environmental sensors are monitored.
Rule27: Under the condition that environmental sensors are monitored, either backup cooling is activated, or the cooling system has not failed.
Rule28: If the maintenance protocol is initiated, then the system check is completed.
Rule29: In the event that management has rejected the IoT upgrade, the smart thermostat is not malfunctioning.
Rule30: If the security incident is investigated, then the security event is logged.
Rule31: Under the condition that the IoT upgrade is implemented, the smart thermostat is not malfunctioning.
Rule32: Provided that the smart lighting is functioning, if the work environment is not optimal, then the server room is overheating.
Rule33: Either the smart lighting is connected to the network, or it is disconnected from the network.
Rule34: Provided that the smart lighting is disconnected from the network, it is functioning.
Rule35: If it is not the case that deploying a smart thermostat in office A leads to an optimal work environment, then the smart thermostat is malfunctioning.
Rule36: Under the condition that management approving the IoT upgrade does not imply the smart thermostat is not malfunctioning, the smart thermostat is repaired.
Rule37: Provided that detecting a temperature spike does not lead to either backup cooling being activated or the cooling system not failing, the maintenance protocol is initiated.
Rule38: When it is not true that completing the system check leads to a technician being dispatched, the incident is escalated.
Rule39: If the smart lighting being connected to the network does not imply its firmware is updated, then access permissions are conflicting.
Rule40: If it is not the case that the security system not being operational results in the security protocol not being bypassed, then the security incident is investigated.
Rule41: Provided that the work environment not being optimal does not imply the server room is overheating, the cooling system is triggered.
Rule42: If the security system is not operational, then the security protocol is bypassed.
Rule43: If the work environment is not optimal, then it is not the case that the server room is overheating.
facts: Fact1: A smart thermostat is deployed in office A.
Fact2: It is not the case that the conference booking is cancelled.
Fact3: The smart thermostat is not damaged.
Fact4: The permission conflict is not resolved.
Fact5: Backup cooling is not activated.
Fact6: A technician is not dispatched.
Fact7: The incident is not escalated.
Fact8: The security event is not logged.
